questions.text: Have I encouraged my wife or felt jealous of her accomplishments?
Have I supported her goals and dreams with love?
Have I withheld affection out of spite or pride?
Have I compared her to others unfairly?
Have I been generous with compliments and praise?
Have I acted selfishly instead of lovingly?
Have I rejoiced in her joy and comforted her in sadness?
Have I shown love even in disagreement?
Have I respected her dignity as a daughter of God?
Have I avoided acts or words that sow resentment?
Have I worked hard to provide for and support my marriage?
Have I done my share of household responsibilities?
Have I taken initiative in prayer or spiritual leadership?
Have I been mentally present in our conversations?
Have I fulfilled promises and commitments to my wife?
Have I avoided procrastinating on things that matter to her?
Have I pursued virtue even when it’s difficult?
Have I been consistent in my role as a husband?
Have I supported her in times of stress or difficulty?
Have I spent quality time without distractions?
Have I looked at my wife with honor and affection?
Have I been faithful in thought, word, and action?
Have I avoided impure media or conversations?
Have I used our intimacy selfishly or lovingly?
Have I spoken about sexuality with reverence and respect?
Have I treated my wife as a person, not an object?
Have I helped her grow in confidence and grace?
Have I respected boundaries and her emotional needs?
Have I shown restraint when needed and love always?
Have I turned to God when tempted by impurity?
Have I lost my temper or spoken harshly to my wife?
Have I been quick to argue rather than understand?
Have I responded to her frustrations with empathy?
Have I prayed for patience when irritated?
Have I apologized after being angry or defensive?
Have I modeled self-control in front of others?
Have I acted out of irritation rather than love?
Have I given her space and time when needed?
Have I listened fully before responding?
Have I practiced forgiveness quickly and sincerely?
Have I put her needs before my own?
Have I been emotionally generous and supportive?
Have I spent time doing things she values?
Have I spoken with kindness and not criticism?
Have I listened without distraction?
Have I given without expecting anything in return?
Have I supported her even when I disagreed?
Have I made her feel cherished?
Have I been gentle in tone and action?
Have I shown God’s love through small daily acts?
Have I used food, drink, or entertainment excessively?
Have I let hobbies or media take priority over my marriage?
Have I kept healthy boundaries with substances or screens?
Have I exercised self-control in time management?
Have I avoided unnecessary expenses or selfish indulgence?
Have I made time for prayer and reflection with her?
Have I modeled balance in work, play, and rest?
Have I used money with mutual respect and stewardship?
Have I been present instead of distracted?
Have I fasted from self-centeredness for her sake?
Have I admitted when I was wrong and asked forgiveness?
Have I allowed her opinions and preferences to lead?
Have I sought to serve rather than dominate?
Have I given credit and thanks freely?
Have I let go of needing to win arguments?
Have I valued her insights and wisdom?
Have I sought God’s help to grow in virtue?
Have I been teachable and open-hearted?
Have I led quietly with love rather than pride?
Have I placed her above myself in our marriage?
